group_1.narration: I came to Kamihama to find a picture book.@One my dad wrote.
My dad was a picture book illustrator.@"Was" meaning...
Before I changed him with magic.
My dad had a very distinct art style@that got him noticed as an artist.@But the interest in him gradually faded away.@Fewer and fewer copies sold until eventually@the crowds of fans disappeared.
He turned to drinking, and every day@he'd take everything out on my mom.@She did her best to endure it and worked@to support the family, but her body gave out.
And so my mom passed away.
After she died, my dad turned to me@to take out all his frustrations.@I tried to bear it as long as I could.@But one day, I couldn't take it anymore.
That was when he showed up.
And I made a wish.@To change my dad into a kind,@upstanding man. A perfect father.
So now, I'm a Witch-fighting Magical Girl.
It's as though I turned into one of the@characters in those picture books.
But it came with a heavy cost.@My dad doesn't make picture books anymore.@He's too busy being the perfect father.@I changed him with my magic.
When I told Arisa about what happened, she@said something that made me feel better.

group_1.textCenter: You didn't do anything wrong, Chisato.

group_1.narration: Your mom wouldn't want your dad to keep@writing those books if it hurt you.

group_1.textCenter: (I wonder if that's why she said she'd come@along with me today.)

group_1.textLeft: Why did you come with me today?

group_1.textRight: And, I guess I was kinda curious?
You know, tracking down that book your@dad wrote and all.

group_1.textLeft: That's right, you did say that...

group_1.narration: It was a few days ago.
It all started with that photograph...
